Synchronizing classes shouldn't have anything to do with setting the schema on your entity tables.  Synchronizing classes just adds the classes to the persistence.xml file.  I believe the 2 issues are separate.

The schema issue can be solved by adding an orm.xml descriptor to the project and specifying the default schema for the Persistence Unit.  This will ensure that the correct schema is used for validation of Entities, and will avoid having to set the schema on each @Table annotation.  We are using your connection user name for the default schema if you have not specified one.

Are you still getting the NPE when you right click on the persistence.xml file and choose to Synchronize Classes?  If so, could you attach the full stack trace that you can get from the Error Log view>
